text:
You're in a chat with the customer. What is the BEST next step to take immediately after your first reply?

Choose ONE option.
options: Explain why deliveries can be delayed and ask the customer to wait.
Ask the customer to repeat the complaint in more detail to 'make sure you understood'.
Check the order status in internal systems using the identifiers and, if something is missing, ask only for that missing detail.
Immediately offer compensation and promise delivery within 30 minutes to calm the customer down.
correct_answer: Verify the order in the system (tracking/dispatch) using the provided identifiers, and clarify the minimum missing detail if needed before promising a solution.
explanation: Verification before action is the core support principle. Option A (explain delays) shifts the burden to the customer and sounds dismissive. Option B (repeat the complaint) wastes time and frustrates an already upset customer. Option D (immediate compensation) violates policy — you cannot promise refunds or compensation before confirming the facts. Option C is correct: check the system first with the identifiers you have, ask only for what's missing, then propose solutions based on verified facts.
ai_context: Evaluate the student's choice. Option 0 (explain delays) is passive and dismissive — it shifts responsibility to the customer. Option 1 (repeat complaint) wastes the customer's time and signals the agent wasn't listening. Option 2 (check system + ask only missing detail) is correct: it's efficient, fact-based, and respects the customer's time. Option 3 (immediate compensation + unrealistic promise) violates policy and sets false expectations. Refer to ISO/SOP references from the test description when providing feedback.
